name: Titanium.UI.Android.ProgressIndicator
summary: A progress dialog or a horizontal progress bar in the title of the window.

events.name: cancel
events.summary: Fired when the user has canceled the progress indicator dialog.
events.description: The user triggers this event by pressing the BACK button when the dialog is visible. The dialog will be hidden and this event dispatched.

methods.name: hide
methods.summary: Hides the progress indicator and stops the animation.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary:
Animation options for Android only. Since SDK 5.1.0 and used only on Android 5.0+

Determines whether to enable a circular reveal animation. Note that the default here is equivalent to passing in { animated: false }

methods.name: show
methods.summary: Shows the progress indicator and starts the animation.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary:
Animation options for Android only. Since SDK 5.1.0 and only used on Android 5.0+

Determines whether to enable a circular reveal animation. Note that the default here is equivalent to passing in { animated: false }

properties.name: cancelable
properties.summary: When true allows the user to cancel the progress dialog by pressing the BACK button.

properties.name: canceledOnTouchOutside
properties.summary: When cancelable is set to true and this is set to true, the dialog is canceled when touched outside the window's bounds.

properties.name: messageid
properties.summary: Key identifying a string in the locale file to use for the message text.
properties.description: Only one of message or messageid should be specified.
